snippet: The loser again claims Kenya’s presidential election was rigged, but major violence, which erupted after the 2007 vote, has so far been absent.
abstract: Chaos that reigned during Kenya's last presidential election has not been repeated, even though candidate Raila Odinga claims his loss was due to vote rigging; lack of violence in wake of Pres-elect Uhuru Kenyatta's victory greatly defies expectations, and shows that raft of reforms implemented after last election seem to have worked.

byline.contributor: Marlise Simons contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The loser again claims Kenya’s presidential election was rigged, but major violence, which erupted after the 2007 vote, has so far been absent.

headline.seo: Kenyan Reaction to Disputed Election Is Far Calmer Than Last Time
headline.main: Kenyan Reaction to Disputed Election Is Far Calmer Than Last Time
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Reaction to Disputed Election Is Far Calmer Than Last Time
